sources¶

dlinputs.sources.basenames(basenamefile, extensions, split=True, epochs=1, shuffle=True, verbose=True, size=(100, 1000000000.0), decode=True)[source]¶

Iterate over training samples given as basenames and extensions.

Parameters:
  • basenamefile – file containing one basename per line
  • extensions – list of expected extensions for each basename
  • split – remove any extension from files in basenamefile
  • epochs – number of times to iterate
  • shuffle – shuffle before training
  • verbose – verbose output
  • size – expected dataset size
Returns:

iterator
dlinputs.sources.bookdir(bookdir, epochs=1, shuffle=True)[source]¶

Read a dataset from an OCRopus-style book directory.

Parameters:
  • bookdir – top level directory in OCRopus bookdir format
  • epochs – number of epochs to iterate for
  • shuffle – shuffle the samples prior to reading
Returns:

iterator
dlinputs.sources.check_ds_size(ds, size)[source]¶

Helper function to check the size of a dataset.

This is mostly just a nice error message

Parameters:
  • ds (int) – dataset size
  • size (tuple) – lower and upper bounds of dataset size
dlinputs.sources.dirtree(top, extensions, epochs=1, shuffle=True, verbose=True, size=(100, 1000000000.0), decode=True)[source]¶

Iterate of training samples in a directory tree.

Parameters:
  • top – top of the directory tree
  • extensions (list,str) – list/comma separated string of extensions
  • epochs (int) – number of epochs to iterate over the data
  • shuffle (bool) – whether to shuffle the data
  • verbose (bool) – whether to output info about the interator
  • size – expected dataset size
Returns:

iterator over samples
dlinputs.sources.generator(source, nrepeats=1000000000)[source]¶

Repeat data from a source (returned by a callable function).

Parameters:
  • source – callable function yielding an iterator
  • nrepeats – number of times to repeat
Returns:

iterator over nrepeats repeats of source
dlinputs.sources.infinite(sample)[source]¶

Repeat the same sample over and over again (for testing).

Parameters:sample – sample to be repeated
Returns:iterator yielding sample
dlinputs.sources.tabular(table, colnames, separator='\t', maxerrors=100, encoding='utf-8', epochs=1, shuffle=True, verbose=True, size=(100, 1000000000.0), decode=True)[source]¶

Iterate over training samples given by a tabular input.

Columns whose names start with “_” are passed on directly as strings, all other columns are interpreted as file names and read.

Parameters:
  • table (str) – tabular input file separated by separator
  • colnames (list,str) – column names (keys in sample), list or comman separated
  • separator (str) – separator for columns in input file
  • maxerrors – maximum number of read errors
  • encoding – text file encoding
  • epochs – number of epochs to iterate
  • shuffle – shuffle data prior to training
  • verbose – verbose output
  • size – expected dataset size
Returns:

iterator
